content:
the OU soccer team collected its first draw of the season during Sundays match against Colorado College finishing in doubleovertime with a deadlocked score  at John Crain Field PERIOD With the tie the Sooners moved to  for the season PERIOD

 coach Nicole Nelson said PERIOD 

Sundays match featured aggressive performances for both teams on both sides of the ball with a total of five cards issued in the first half PERIOD Both goals scored in the game were off penalty kicks PERIOD

The Sooners were forced to play one man down for  minutes of the game after senior defender Lauren Alkek received a red card in the first half PERIOD Nelson was proud of the ability of the team to last through the remainder of the game shorthanded and hold off a physical opponent in overtime PERIOD

 Nelson said PERIOD 

The Sooners led early in the contest after senior forward Whitney Palmer took advantage of a penalty kick at the fourminute mark PERIOD The score  Palmers third career penalty kick goal  brought her career goal total to  four shy of tying OUs career recorder holder Logan Womack  PERIOD

More than getting closer to top spot Palmer was relieved to get out of what she felt like was a scoring  for the Sooners PERIOD

 Palmer said about the draw and the goal PERIOD 

Colorado College responded in the thirty-second minute to even up the score with a goal by forward Tiffany Brown PERIOD Browns goal off a penalty kick was her second of the season PERIOD

Both defenses played tough the first  minutes PERIOD The Tigers goalkeeper Caitlin Hulyo made nine saves in regulation PERIOD Sooner goalkeeper Kelsey Devonshire had eight saves before overtime PERIOD

The Sooners had a chance to score in the second overtime period after Caitlyn Mooney broke a quick pass from midfield PERIOD Mooney moved the ball in open space left to right just overshooting Palmer in the box PERIOD

The Sooners kept the pressure on offense collecting three more shots on goal in the overtime periods forcing Hulyo to make two more saves before the game ended in the draw PERIOD

The Sooners hit the road next weekend to face Missouri State at  p.m PERIOD Friday in Springfield Mo PERIOD OU returns home to face Rice at  p.m PERIOD Sunday at John Crain Field PERIOD

title: OU soccer takes Colorado College to a draw | Sports | oudaily.com
name: University of Oklahoma
